intro: Diarthron iranicum subsp. iranicum, commonly known as the Iranian thornvetch, is a perennial leguminous plant native to the Middle East and Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in racemes, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its root system is fibrous and capable of fixing atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils.
